intro: Diosma speciosa, commonly known as the showy diosma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinct, spicy scent when crushed. Diosma speciosa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
